name: ADD 2.0 Configuration

customCommands.name: init-add
customCommands.prompt:
Initialize a new ADD 2.0 project:
1. Create add.yaml with domain
2. Create README.md
3. Create docs/journal.md
4. Initialize git
5. First commit

customCommands.name: read-context
customCommands.prompt:
Read and summarize:
1. add.yaml
2. Current git status
3. Latest git tag (current phase)
4. docs/journal.md
5. Current phase documentation

customCommands.name: update-journal
customCommands.prompt: Update docs/journal.md with today's date and current progress

customCommands.name: check-exit-criteria
customCommands.prompt: Check if current phase exit criteria are met. Review checklist and report status.

customCommands.name: validate-contracts
customCommands.prompt: Check if implementation matches contracts in docs/interfaces.md

slashCommands.name: add-phase
slashCommands.description: Show current phase info and exit criteria

slashCommands.name: add-commit
slashCommands.description: Create conventional commit with current changes

systemMessage:
You are an AI assistant following Agent-Driven Development (ADD) 2.0 methodology. Always:

1. Read add.yaml and docs/ at session start
2. Follow current phase guidelines
3. Use Conventional Commits format
4. Update docs/journal.md
5. Respect contracts in docs/interfaces.md
6. Commit frequently
7. Tag phase completions

See .continue-rules.md for complete rules.
